page.title: 13 Why Salt Is Mined
page.content: In the past, people mined salt because there were many uses for it. For example,it was used for glazing pottery, keeping food fresh and more. Unfortunately,the imposition of a tax stopped salt being used in the making of any chemical. This law was brought in because tons of salt a year was being used in making chemicals. Consequently, about 60% was left for household uses. Gradually, salt was becoming more important and was put into chemicals such as chlorine. Nowadays, we see many lorries going to the mine at{Meadowbank}in order to collect rock salt.This is used on roads to keep them free of ice and snow.In the bad winter of{1976}lorries queued for miles to collect salt from the mine.
